result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha V. BIES was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money as repeater [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Forgery as repeater [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with John Her, James Meinelt, Justin Feurstein, Peter Haen and Festival.  

Submit DNA sample.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
Eight (8) months up front, under the Huber Law.   
Four (4) months stayed, to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.   Transfer to Sheboygan County Jail is authorized with the condition that there is no bracelet.

Stipulation and Order Granting Furlough
The court orders that Defendant is granted a furlough from the sentences imposed in the above-captioned cases begining at 8:00 a.m. on June 15, 2016 and concluding at 8:30 a.m. on June 20, 2016. Upon conclusion of the furlough, defendant will report to the electronic monitoring program representative in Sheboygan.
Copy to Jail.
Amending repeater statute to 939.62(1)(b) on counts 1 and 2.

Order Amending Judgment of Conviction.
It is hereby ordered that the repeater allegation as to counts 1 and 2 shall be entered as Section 939.62(1)(b) Wis. Stats. and the judgment of Conviciton shall be amended to reflect the same.

State is making a request to correct the record to an enhancer of 939.62(1)(b) of the Wisconsin Statutes.   Court grants the request to amend the enhancer to 939.62(1)(b).

records.addlTxt:
Count 1 - Misappropriate ID Info, as repeater - No contest plea. 
Count 2 - Forgery, as repeater - No contest plea. 
Count 3 - Bail Jumping - No contest plea.   Convicted.   Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.   Sentencing hearing is set for 02-26-16 at 9:30 a.m.   Report to be filed by 02-15-16.   Court orders defendant to submit DNA sample.   Court orders defendant's bail revoked.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 12-03-14 at 2:15 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with the co-defendant, James Meinelt.
